annotation.TEXT: Goal!
Am I good? ...Yep, looks like I'm good. Just watch out for the flames when they start appearing.
Done! Hmm, this one sounds interesting. I'll check it out later.

Oh, and by the way, the lava itself is harmless to the player, just like in the original SMB. It's just that usually the player would die from falling into the pit below the lava, but of course Bouncy Pits prevents that.
I'm powering up just in case I take a hit. Although, if I do end up dying, it's no big deal. Alright, now where's a good place for me to stomp a lot of bullets?

...Wait, didn't I already do that? ...Oh, right! When the version updates occurred earlier, I had to redo stuff, as my old saves were no good. However, I never beat the original SMB again. One moment please...
Awesome. With "Always Break Bricks" active, Bill can now destroy the bricks with his head, and I assume every other character can as well.

Whoa! Okay, I assume that those ceiling bricks apparently respawning means that I did take the correct paths. (Actually, the bricks didn't respawn. I was just teleported to another place that looks identical, except the bricks over here weren't destroyed yet.)
BOING!!!
Whoops, accidentally unpaused there.
Alright, back to ludicrous speed!
"All Hammer Bros" is unlocked by beating the SMB Special map set.
Yeah, gotta have those fireworks!
"Always Break Bricks" is unlocked by beating the game once and breaking 1000 bricks. Yeah, I've probably broken several tons more than that by now!
Yep, I've gotta do this section again. However, this is technically a different place on the map from my first trip through, so the bricks here haven't been destroyed yet.
BOING!!!
Hmm... The ground appears to be made of bricks on the character select screen now... Well, let's go with the AWESOME SPREAD GUN one more time!
Let's go with more AWESOME SPREAD GUN usage in the next level!
..."Roddy"? I'm guessing that's the name of the protagonist in Blaster Master: Blasting Again.

"Evil Hammer Bros" is unlocked by defeating 50 Hammer Bros., which I did recently. "Extra Checkpoints" is unlocked by beating Bowser's Castle. So, I think any X-4 level. "Infinite Ammo" is unlocked by beating the game once & getting 200 ammo pickups.
Alright, it's boss time! I'm going to try the NES Metroid Ridley strategy here! Just watch out for the hammers and Podoboo as I get into position...

Alright, here's the cheats that I've already unlocked so far. The ?????? ones have not been unlocked yet, and if you click on a ?????? one, it'll tell you the requirements you need to fulfill to unlock it.

Ah, for this one, I need to defeat things like Buzzy Beetles and Bullet Bills. For cheats like this where a certain quantity of something is needed, it'll tell you how many you've got so far. So, I need 102 more for this one.
I wonder why the requirement is 300 fish anyway... For armored enemies and stomps, the requirement was only 200. Oh, well. Whatever.
So, my goal is to slaughter 300 cheepos, and they start showing up after the first pit in 2-2 and 7-2.
Alright, so which cheats should I show off and which characters should I use next time? Place your votes now! To be continued...
Well, anyway. Let's proceed through the rest of the level, while killing every single aquatic life form I see. (Well, at least the aquatic life forms that are out to kill me.)
R.O.B. may win!
Oh, and that's the last one. As for "Enter Code", I know what that does, but I'm not going to touch that right now.
BGM: Contra (NES) - Base Theme
Oh, and since I have to kill so many fish, I'd hate to end up dying and losing my AWESOME SPREAD GUN, so I'm going to turn on the "Invincible" cheat now.
I'm not going to go to ludicrous speed here. I'll show this level at normal speed. Now, since I'm using a character that can't swim, he just jumps really high instead.
And, this time, my AWESOME SPREAD GUN guy is armed with the AWESOME SPREAD GUN!
D'oh! I blew it again! There's still more koopas in the level, but I'm going to be really disappointed if I accidentally kill them all!

Meanwhile, I'll park myself to the left of this cannon, while facing left. I'm close enough to it that it won't blow my brains out, and I'm facing left so that I won't accidentally hit the koopa while I'm shooting at the bullets that fly overhead. Now, this will take a while, so I'm going to go to ludicrous speed with the footage for a moment here!

Whoops. That's right. The time limit could be an issue. So, I think I'll turn on the "Infinite Time" cheat. You probably remember seeing me use this before, and it simply removes the time limit. If you later disable the cheat, the time limit will be set to whatever it should be at, or it'll be set to 100 if it would've been below 100.
BGM: Super Mario 64 - Metal Cap
I wonder how close I am...

Hello, and welcome back to some more SMB Crossover! Yeah, it's been a while, but whatever. Today, I'm going to start going over the cheats. First, let's look at the cheat list and see what I've got so far.
Haha! Wow, that thing got some serious air! Nice!
Okay, let's take the correct paths again, and not accidentally pass over an "incorrect path" trigger this time.
Alright, it's ludicrous speed time again!
Oh, there's another Blurp. Okay, I guess the slow fish are Blurps, and the fast ones are Boos.
Oh, right. I should turn on "Infinite Time" again.
Aww... If I had been using the Mario brothers more, I might've had this one by now. But, I wanted to use a variety of characters as I was playing. Alright, give me a moment here...
Okay, I just need the answer to life, the universe, and everything more cheepo kills.

Gotcha! Unfortunately, the ground just under the axe didn't change to bricks, probably to keep the end-of-castle cutscene from being screwed up, so I have to go around, meaning I have to dodge the Podoboo a couple more times.
Alright, now to gun down Bowser from below!
And this is why I left Bouncy Pits on. Hmm... I think I should try out another cheat here as well.
I'll give the other robot a turn this time.

Okay, now "Classic Samus", "Classic Screen Scroll", "Classic Simon", and "Everyone Can Stomp" start off already unlocked to begin with. (D'oh! I should've shown off "Everyone Can Stomp" while fulfilling the stomping requirement there. Well, I'll show it later.)
BOING!!!
Simply turning on a cheat shouldn't affect the enemy skins, should it?
Those are some lame fireworks...
Let's try just letting the next koopa walk into a pit, if I can keep from accidentally killing it...
Also, I'll go with Infinite Time too, since this'll take a while, and I'm leaving Bouncy Pits turned on as well, so that I can't die that way either.
Watch out for the fire bar, as I'm not invincible anymore, since I turned that cheat off.
Done! Hmm... I wonder what "Water Mode" does... Well, I think I know, but we'll see for sure later. Now, back to the cheat list...
Perfect. I've shot the koopa exactly enough times to stun him, and now with a simple kick, it'll slaughter a lot of bullets for me!
Hopefully, the game still thinks that I'm taking the correct paths here...
BOING!!!
Oh, I just realized something. I should be very careful with how I shoot around here, since this is one of those "maze" castles where I have to take the correct paths.
Also, I'm turning off Infinite Time and Invincible now, but I'll leave Bouncy Pits turned on, for a very good reason...
BOING!!!
Huh. Did I just see a Trouter bounce off the bottom of the screen a moment ago? Does Bouncy Pits affect enemies too?

Not only that, but 7-1's got something else that'll help me with this as well. Also, I'm going to use the "Classic Screen Scroll" cheat to help me out here. It prevents the screen from scrolling to the left, just like in the original SMB.
So, let's keep tearing up the place!
Ah, there we go! I do remember unlocking that cheat before, but I had to do it again due to the version updates earlier.
And let's watch the ludicrous speed credits roll... WHEEEE!!!
...D'oh! I just realized that I could've killed two birds with one stone here, by fulfilling both the armored enemies and stomping requirements at once by having Mario stomp bullets! Oh, well.
I definitely don't want that "M", that's for sure. Alright, will the third koopa be the charm?
Well, since I'm already at 7-1, let's use Mario in 7-1 and stomp a bunch of bullets!
And, that's that! Alright, let's just grab the magic crystal ball here...
Wait, what? Oh, nuts. The game must've interpreted my position there as a wrong path, so now I have to repeat this section.
Okay, looks like I took the correct paths there as well.
Alright, what's next on the agenda? Oh, and I'll let you guys know what the requirements were for cheats I've already unlocked too.
BOING!!!

Alright, to do this one, I've brought the AWESOME SPREAD GUN guy to world 7-1 of the original SMB, but I've armed him with the Fireball weapon, which can destroy armored enemies, and 7-1's got plenty of Bullet Bills!
D'oh! I accidentally destroyed the koopa. Well, I'll try it with the next koopa then.
Ha! That Trouter went right through me, but since I have the Invincible cheat active, I'm unharmed!
Shut up, clock. I'm at the boss now.
So, which cheat should I try out next? How about "All Ground is Bricks"? That one sounds interesting.
BOING!!!
BOING!!!
Okay, good. Now, just wait for it to walk off the edge...
(In Laharl's voice) Haaahahahaha!!!
So, I have to murder lots of cheepos for this one, eh? Well, I'm already close to a couple of good levels to do this in, so let's jump straight to 7-2 here!
Alright, I've slain several cheepos (Blurps/Boos) here, but I do believe I can filet-o-fish much faster in the next level!
Hey, hey! Alright, I got it! ...Ooh, I like the sound of this one! I'll be sure to check it out in the future.
I'm gonna have to be careful with my jumps here, of course, but I should be okay.
Ah, so they resemble SMB2 Trouters this time.
Die, goofy-looking Bowser!!!
Okay, so which cheat will I have to unlock next?
Uh, oh. There's cutoff! This hack won't be accepted at SMW Central!
This is a pretty cool cheat! ...Huh, I wonder why the cheepo sprites changed to SMW Boos now? The first cheepo that appeared before I turned on the "Bouncy Pits" cheat looked like a Blurp instead.
However, it won't function immediately. I'll have to complete the level I'm currently in the middle of first.
I'll try kicking the next koopa I see into a pit.

Oh, between those two cannons back here should work well. And it helps that if a kicked koopa despawns off screen in Crossover, it's considered dead, so the koopa that was between these cannons is gone now!
Alright, here's the first pit. Oh! Speaking of pits, I think I want to try out the "Bouncy Pits" cheat now! Let's see if it does what I think it'll do...
Before the first pit, I only encounter Bloopers.
BOING!!!
Oh, man. That one's not happening for a while. I haven't even touched Hard mode yet!
BGM: Contra: Hard Corps - Simon1994RD
Uhh... You're welcome dude. Um, who are you, anyway?

"Infinite Lives" is unlocked by beating the game without using a continue. "Infinite Time" is unlocked by beating any level. Yeah, it's that simple. "Invincible" is unlocked by beating the game once and defeating 1000 enemies.
Yeah, Bouncy Pits looks like a fun cheat alright! Okay, back to cheepo-killing. Let's go to ludicrous speed now!
BOING!!!
